Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbalnauts. I don't know where the appropriate place to make this thread is, so if it's in the wrong place, please tell me.

I Just noticed that the wiki page for Laythe has listed the Semi-major axis, Apoapsis, and Periapsis as 27Ã¢â‚¬â€°184Ã¢â‚¬â€°000 m, when it is actually 21 184 000 m.

I would change the wiki, but I want to make sure that the wiki is messed up, and it isn't just my game. (Also I don't think I can edit the wiki).

So far, 3 kerbals have died due to this error.

Are you possibly confusing Laythe's apoapsis with the altitude reading above the surface of Jool? Because the apoapsis in the wiki is measured from the center of Jool, not its surface.

Edited February 5, 2014 by Brotoro

>_< I am clearly not thinking straight,oh well, that's what I get for playing so late at night. I'm glad I posted in the forums before doing anything radical. Thanks for clearing that up!

( P.s. I really like your mission report series )
